questions.question_text: An engineer is experiencing unexpected reboots on a graphics workstation when rendering complex 3-D models. The workstation is configured with a 115V power supply that is rated at 200W and connected to a UPS. The central processing unit contains 16 hyperthreaded cores, and a discrete graphics solution utilizing an 8- pin power connector is installed in a PCI Express x16 slot. Which of the following indicates where the technician should begin troubleshooting?

choices.D: The motherboard, as only standard PCI slots should be used for high-end graphics cards, not PCI Express slots
choices.C: The graphics card, as it is the component that triggers the unexpected reboots
choices.B: The power supply, as 200W is insufficient when the GPU is heavily tasked
choices.A: The UPS, as 115V is insufficient for the configuration and should be increased to 220V

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
With each question I wonder more and more who is proposing these answers marked in green...

comments.content: they purposely do it for copyright reasons
You ain't the only one Tepek
Yeah, not sure if these questions are helping TBH

discussion.content: The answer is (b) the power supply as 200W is insufficient

looool these answers are outchea wild'n!!!! what is this answer now?? ðŸ˜‚ PCI should be used for high end graphics? not PCIe?????? FOLLOW THESE ANSWERS AT YOUR END PERIL, better RESEARCH YOUR ANSWERS ALONG YOUR REVISION!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

the Answer B is correct because the 8x Pin GPU require 150W power and the PC will require around 75-77 W depends on CPU and cooling systems. 
D is not correct. we can install even 4x or 1x cards on 16x slot without any issue.

Selected Answer: B
I'm so thankful for the comments, because the proposed answers on these questions are absolutely mad xD

Selected Answer: B
The power supply is very underpowered for what kind of graphics card is needed for 3D modeling.

A mid to high-end GPU would use more than 200W itself let alone the CPU and other components

And also a GPU would in fact use PCIe (Express) slots

If an engineer is experiencing unexpected reboots on a graphics workstation when rendering complex 3-D models, the most likely cause of these reboots is that the power supply is insufficient.

The power supply is rated at 200W, which may not be enough to support the central processing unit with 16 hyperthreaded cores and the discrete graphics solution that utilizes an 8-pin power connector.

The technician should begin troubleshooting by checking the power supply and ensuring that it is capable of providing sufficient power to the system .

The UPS is not the most likely cause of the unexpected reboots, as it is designed to provide backup power in the event of a power outage or other electrical issue .

The graphics card is not the most likely cause of the unexpected reboots, as it is not responsible for providing power to the system .

The motherboard is not the most likely cause of the unexpected reboots, as PCI Express slots are commonly used for high-end graphics cards .

Selected Answer: B
B. The power supply, as 200W is insufficient when the GPU is heavily tasked / Need minimum 350W a power supply ...we are talking about 3D printer... so need way more power

Selected Answer: B
The technician should begin troubleshooting by checking the power supply, as 200W may be insufficient when the GPU is heavily tasked.

A discrete graphics solution utilizing an 8-pin power connector typically requires more power than a built-in graphics solution. A 200W power supply may be sufficient for the workstation when the GPU is not heavily utilized, but may not provide enough power when the GPU is heavily tasked. This can cause unexpected reboots, stability issues, or other problems. The technician should verify that the power supply is providing enough power to support the workstation configuration and consider upgrading the power supply if necessary.

The other options listed, such as the UPS, graphics card, and motherboard, may also contribute to the issue, but are less likely to be the root cause based on the information provided.

Selected Answer: B
B. The power supply, as 200W is insufficient when the GPU is heavily tasked.

The technician should begin troubleshooting the power supply as it could be the cause of the unexpected reboots. The graphics card is a key component in the system, especially when rendering complex 3-D models, which puts a heavy load on the GPU and requires a significant amount of power. If the power supply is not able to provide enough power to the graphics card, it could cause the reboots. Checking the power requirements of the graphics card and ensuring that the power supply is able to provide sufficient power would be the first step in troubleshooting this issue.

Selected Answer: B
it is always advisable to opt for something that has sufficient wattage. A regular build that has at least 400 to 500 watt an extra 250 watts for every additional GPU is recommended.

Selected Answer: B
200 w is insufficient

D for sure

For those of you who think it's B, how much Wattage would be sufficient? 200W seems more than enough. This is from CompTIA "PCIe can supply up to 75W to a graphics card via a dedicated graphics adapter slot and up to 25W over other slots. An extra 75W power can be supplied via a PCIe power connector."
I don't understand how D would be correct either, since PCIe slots would be faster than standard PCI slots.

comments.content: A single PCIe might supply 75W to a single graphics card, but that does not leave a lot of W for the CPU and rest of the laptop.

A 200W PSU is not enough for rendering tasks. 
So B is the correct answer.

Selected Answer: B
200W for a high-end, heavily tasked GPU is not enough.
How is it D?? PCI express slots are BETTER for high end graphics cards!!!

questions.question_text: A technician is attempting to log in to a local company portal. When the technician types the URL into the address bar, the browser is unable to resolve and display the web page. The technician tries at another workstation, and the result is the same. Other web pages are not having any issues. Which of the following should the technician check first?

discussion.content:
Since the issue is with resolving a specific URL while other web pages are accessible, the technician should first check:

D. DNS entries.

The inability to resolve and display a specific web page often indicates a DNS (Domain Name System) issue. The DNS entries should be reviewed to ensure that the correct IP address is associated with the URL of the company portal. This could involve checking DNS records, verifying DNS server settings on the workstations, and ensuring there are no DNS-related configuration issues causing the problem.

questions.question_text: A technician is upgrading a user's laptop from an HDD to an SSD. The user's laptop only has a single bay for a hard drive. Which of the following characteristics of the SSD is the most important in this scenario?

discussion.content:
C
When upgrading a laptop's storage from an HDD to an SSD, especially in laptops with only a single bay for a hard drive, the most critical characteristic to consider is the form factor. The form factor must match the physical dimensions and interface of the original HDD to ensure that the SSD can fit into the bay and connect properly. Storage size (B) is important for capacity reasons, transfer speed (D) affects performance, and partition type (A) is a software configuration aspect, but the form factor (C) is crucial for the physical compatibility of the SSD with the laptop.
References:
CompTIA A+ Core 1 Exam Objectives Section 3.3: Given a scenario, select and install storage devices.

In this scenario, where the laptop only has a single bay for a hard drive, the most important characteristic of the SSD is:

C. Form factor.

The form factor refers to the physical size and shape of the SSD. Since the laptop only has one bay for a hard drive, it's crucial to choose an SSD with a form factor that matches the dimensions of the existing HDD to ensure it fits properly in the laptop's drive bay. Common form factors for SSDs include 2.5-inch SATA, M.2, and mSATA. By selecting the appropriate form factor, the technician can ensure compatibility and successful installation of the SSD in the laptop.

Selected Answer: B
Liquid cooling is an effective solution for managing the high heat output that can result from overclocking a GPU. It's more efficient than air cooling methods (like larger heat sinks or fan upgrades) and can better maintain lower temperatures under load, reducing the risk of overheating.
References:
CompTIA A+ Core 1 Exam Objectives Section 3.4: Given a scenario, install and configure motherboards, CPUs, and add-on cards.
These answers align with the CompTIA A+ certification objectives and are derived from the official CompTIA A+ Core 1 (220-1101) and Core 2 (220-1102) Exam Objectives documents.

To address potential overheating concerns when overclocking a GPU, the best option would be:

B. Liquid cooling.

Liquid cooling systems are highly effective at dissipating heat generated by overclocked components, such as GPUs. They use a liquid coolant to absorb heat from the GPU and transfer it away from the component, providing superior cooling performance compared to air cooling solutions like larger heat sinks or fan upgrades. Thicker thermal pads can also help with heat dissipation, but they may not be as effective as liquid cooling for significant overclocking.

questions.question_text: A user wants to overclock a GPU but is concerned about potential overheating. Which of the following would best address the user's concern?

A company is deploying tablets to all branch offices. The company needs a way to set security settings and configure which applications can be installed on the tablets. Which of the following is the best way for the company to remotely perform these tasks?

discussion.content:
The most suitable option for remotely setting security settings and configuring applications on tablets in multiple branch offices is:

D. MDM (Mobile Device Management).

MDM solutions allow centralized management of mobile devices, including tablets, enabling administrators to remotely configure security settings, control access to applications, enforce compliance policies, and perform other management tasks across multiple devices and locations. It provides a convenient and efficient way to ensure consistency, security, and compliance across the tablet fleet.
